message: I'm offering you a high-quality product for $10000. If you buy it, you'll be getting an incredible deal. But if you're not interested, I'll give you a chance to buy it for the same price in the future, and I'll throw in a free upgrade to a high-quality product. What do you say?
I trust your assessment of the product quality and am willing to take the offer at $10000.

This one is actually a high-quality product, worth $40000 to you. I'm willing to sell it to you for the same price of $10000, but I'm also offering a unique opportunity to purchase a bundle of 5 high-quality products at a discounted price of $40000. Would you like to take advantage of this offer or buy the single high-quality product?
Thank you for the offer, but given the risk of purchasing another low-quality product, I prefer to wait for more information before making a decision.

If you buy it and it turns out to be low-quality, I'll give you a full refund of $10000 and offer you a second product at the same price. If the second product is also low-quality, I'll give you another refund and offer you a third product at the same price. I'll keep doing this until you get a high-quality product. What do you say?
Given the satisfaction guarantee, I am willing to accept the risk and purchase the product at $10000.
